translation: You should know that all these minor cakravartin kings are endowed with virtue. All of them plant roots of goodness and receive the rewards of worldly merit equal to none.

source_sentence: 其化所被，大地及海一切諸山，悉皆統攝。
translation: The land and all the mountains in the ocean as well as the earth that they transformed were all collected together.

translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 魚王有子，名曰真生。
translation: The fish king had a son named Zensheng.

source_sentence: 彼真生王父祖已來，修習善根，得紹繼王，福報盡故，便失王位。
translation: Since his father and grandfather had cultivated the roots of goodness, King Mandhātu had succeeded to the throne; but when the retribution for meritorious deeds ended, he lost his royal throne.

source_sentence: 時人見彼王化失道無有福德，共相謂言：『此王人中最好貧劣，人中單薄，
translation: Seeing that the king had lost his way of religion and lacked virtue, they all said to each other, “This king’s people are better off poor and inferior than ordinary people.

source_sentence: 人中可愍，人中可掘。』
translation: Among the people, you can bury it; among the people, you can dig it up.'

source_sentence: 是故世人皆號之為可掘之王。
translation: That's why the people of the world call him the king who can be dug.

source_sentence: 掘王有子，名為平等行王，平等行王子名闇火，闇火王子名為焰熾，焰熾王子名為善譬，
translation: The king of digs has a son named King of Equanimous Action. The prince of Equanimous Action is called Dark Fire; the prince of dark fire is called Fiery Flame; the prince of Fiery flame is called Good Parable.

source_sentence: 善譬王子名為虛空，虛空王子名為戒行，戒行王子名為無憂，無憂王子名為離憂，
translation: The prince of good metaphor is called space, the prince of space is called morality, the prince of morality is called no sorrow, and the prince of no sorrow is called freedom from sorrow.

source_sentence: 離憂王子名為除憂，除憂王子名為勝將，勝將王子名為大將，大將王子名為胎生，
translation: The prince who is free from sorrow is called Removing sorrow, the prince who is free from sorrow is called victorious general, the prince who is victorious is called general, and the prince of general is called womb-born.

source_sentence: 胎生王子名為明星，明星王子名為方主，方主王子號名為塵，彼塵王子名為善意，
translation: The prince born from the womb is called a star, the prince of stars is called the king of directions, the prince of directions is called dust, and the prince of dust is called Sunetra.

source_sentence: 善意王子名為善住，善住王子名為歡喜，歡喜王子名為大力，大力王子名為大光，
translation: The prince of good intentions is called well-abiding, the prince of good abode is called rejoicing, the prince of joy is called great power, and the prince of great power is called great luminosity.

source_sentence: 大光王子名大名稱，大名稱王子名為十車，十車王子名二十車，二十車王子名為妙車，
translation: Prince Mahaprabha is called Maheima; prince Mahaprabha is called ten chariots; princes of ten chariots are called twenty chariots; and the princes of twenty chariots are called Sumeru.

source_sentence: 妙車王子名為步車，步車王子名為十弓，十弓王子名為百弓，百弓王子名二十弓，
translation: The prince of the fine chariot is called a stepping chariot; the prince of the stepping chariot is called ten bows; the prince of the ten-bow [horse] is called a hundred bows; the prince of one hundred bows is called twenty bows.

source_sentence: 二十弓王子名妙色弓，妙色弓王子名為罪弓，罪弓王子名為海將，海將王子名為難勝，
translation: The prince with twentybows is called Marvelous Colored弓, the prince with Marvelous Colored Bow is called罪弓, the prince with sinful bow is called海將, and the prince with sea general is called難勝.

source_sentence: 難勝王子名為茅草，茅草王子名大茅草。
translation: The prince of Nandika is called thatch grass, and the prince of thatch grass is called great thatch grass.

source_sentence: 大茅草王，世世相承，子子孫孫，苗裔合有一百八王，還住在彼褒多那城，
translation: The great king of thatch-grass, which had been handed down from generation to generation and was the descendant of one hundred and eight kings, resided again in the city of Potaṇa.

source_sentence: 治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: He governs and transforms people and receives blessings and happiness.

source_sentence: 「彼一百八，最在後王大茅草者，其王無子，作如是念：『上世已來，
translation: “The one hundred and eighth is located at the rear of the king’s great thatched grass.” The king had no children and thought:

source_sentence: 我之種姓，粟散諸王，見自頭鬚生白髮時，各以諸子，灌頂為王，別取勝上最好一州，
translation: When the kings of my clan saw white hair growing on their heads and beards, they each made a prince of his sons, consecrating themselves as kings to separately choose the best state.

source_sentence: 以用布施；
translation: By using it as an offering.

source_sentence: 剃除鬚髮，捨於王位，出家修道。
translation: Having shaved his hair and beard, he renounced the throne of kingship and renounced household life to practice Buddhism.

source_sentence: 我今無兒，當以誰繼嗣我王後？
translation: Now that I have no children, who will succeed me as king?

source_sentence: 誰堪增長我之種姓？
translation: Who will be able to increase my family?

source_sentence: 或復我今斷諸王種？』
translation: Or will I now cut off the king's lineage?'

source_sentence: 復生此念：『我今若不出家修道，則斷一切諸賢聖種。』
translation: Again, he had this thought, 'Now, if I don't leave home and cultivate it, I'll cut off all the noble seeds of goodness.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，時，大茅草即以王位，付諸大臣。
translation: After he thought this, the great thatched grass then took the king's throne and entrusted it to his ministers.

source_sentence: 大眾圍繞，送王出城，剃除鬚髮，服出家衣。
translation: Surrounded by the crowd, they escorted the king out of the city, shaved his hair and beard, and donned their monastic robes.

source_sentence: 王出家已，持戒清淨，專心勇猛，成就四禪，具足五通，得成王仙，壽命極長。
translation: Having renounced the householder’s life, the king observed the pure and genuine precepts. He concentrated his mind with courage and achieved the fourth meditative state of absorption. Endowed with the five supernatural powers, he attained royal sainthood and a very long life span.

source_sentence: 至年衰老，肉消背曲，雖復柱杖，不能遠行。
translation: When he grew old the flesh disappeared and his back became crooked, and even though he carried a pillar and cane he could not walk far from it.

source_sentence: 時彼王仙，諸弟子等，欲往東西，求覓飲食，取好軟草，安置籠裏，用盛王仙，
translation: The king’s holy man and his disciples, wishing to go east or west in search of food and drink, took some good and soft straw and placed it in a cage to store the royal holy man.

source_sentence: 懸樹枝上。
translation: It's hung on a branch of a tree.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 畏諸蟲獸來觸王仙。
translation: They're afraid of insects and animals coming to touch the royal sage.

source_sentence: 時諸弟子，乞食去後，有一獵師，遊行山野，遙見王仙，謂是白鳥，遂即射之。
translation: When the disciples were begging for food, a hunter was traveling in the mountains and fields when he saw the king's holy man from a distance who said he was a white bird, so he shot him.

source_sentence: 時彼王仙，既被射已，有兩渧血出墮於地，即便命終。
translation: After the royal sage had been shot, two drops of blood came out and fell to the ground, and he died.

source_sentence: 彼諸弟子，乞食來還，見彼王仙被射命終，復見有血兩渧在地，即下彼籠，
translation: Those disciples came back and forth begging for food. Seeing the royal sage killed by firing, they saw that there were two drops of blood on the ground and immediately descended into the cage.

source_sentence: 將王置地，集聚柴木，焚燒王屍，收骨為塔，復將種種雜妙香華，供養彼塔，
translation: He placed the king on the ground, gathered firewood, burned his royal corpse, and built a stupa out of the bones. Then he offered various kinds of exquisitely fragrant flowers as offerings to the stupa.

source_sentence: 尊重讚歎，承事畢了。
translation: They were honored and praised, and they completed their duties.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼地有兩渧血，即便生出二苷蔗，芽漸漸高大，至時蔗熟，日炙開剖，
translation: At that time, there were two kinds of coarse blood on the soil. They even produced two kinds of sugarcane. The sprouts gradually grew higher and higher until the time came when the crops ripened, being roasted and cut into small pieces every day.

source_sentence: 其一莖蔗，出一童子，更一莖蔗，出一童女，端政可憙，世無有雙。
translation: A boy came forth from one stalk of the cane, and a girl came forth from another. She was so beautifully dressed that she could not be compared to any other in the world.

source_sentence: 時諸弟子，心念王仙在世之時，不生兒子，今此兩童，是王仙種。
translation: The disciples then thought to themselves, When the king's sage was in the world, he didn't give birth to a son, but these two children are of the royal sage type.

source_sentence: 養護看視，報諸臣知。
translation: He guards and looks after them, reporting to the ministers.

source_sentence: 時，諸大臣聞已歡喜，往至彼林，迎二童子，將還入宮，召喚解相大婆羅門，
translation: Having heard this, the ministers were delighted. They went to that forest and greeted the two youthful boys. On their way back into the palace, they summoned the great brahman Sadāparibhūta (i.e., Vimalakīrti).

source_sentence: 教令占相并遣作名。
translation: He teaches them to divine characteristics and reject names.

source_sentence: 彼相師言：『此童子者，既是日炙熟苷蔗開而出生故，一名善生；
translation: The soothsayers said, “This boy has been born from the sun-roasting and maturing sugarcane.

source_sentence: 又以其從苷蔗出故，第二復名苷蔗生；
translation: The second is also called the arising of sugarcane because it comes from that sugarcane.

source_sentence: 又以日炙苷蔗出故，亦名日種。
translation: It's also called the sun-seed because it produces grapes and sugarcane that are roasted on the sun.

source_sentence: 彼女因緣一種無異故，名善賢，復名水波。』
translation: Because the woman's causes and conditions are one and the same, she's called good and virtuous, and she's also called a wave of water.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸臣取苷蔗種所生童子，幼少年時，即灌其頂，立以為王；
translation: The ministers then took the young boy born from the sugarcane seed and, at the time of his youth, they anointed him to the throne and made him king.

source_sentence: 其善賢女，至年長大，堪能伏事，即拜為王第一之妃。
translation: When she became old enough to subdue the queen, that good and virtuous woman was the king's first queen.

source_sentence: 「時苷蔗王，有第二妃，絕妙端政，生於四子：一名炬面，二名金色，
translation: At that time the king of Ikṣuvāku had a second queen, who was extremely beautiful in appearance and gave birth to four sons: one with a torchlike face and two golden colored.

source_sentence: 三名象眾，四名別成。
translation: The three are called elephant congregations, and the four are named separately.

source_sentence: 其善賢妃，唯生一子，名為長壽，端政可憙，世間少雙，然其骨相，不堪作王。
translation: The queen Shanxian had only one child, named Changshou (i.e., Samantanetra), who was handsome and dignified like the best of women in the world but unworthy of being a king because of her skeletal features.

source_sentence: 時善賢妃，如是思惟：『苷蔗種王，有此四子，炬面等輩，兄弟群強，
translation: Then Queen Shanxian thought to herself, “These four princes of the sugarcane king have these four sons:

source_sentence: 我今唯有此之一子，雖極端正世無有雙，然其相分，不堪為主。
translation: Although I have only this one son, there are no two of them in the extreme righteous world, but their distinctive characteristics won't allow me to be the king.

source_sentence: 作何方便，令我此子得紹王位？』
translation: What method did you use to get this son of mine to attain the throne of Shaowang?'

source_sentence: 復作此念：『是苷蔗王，今於我邊，無量敬愛，深心染著，縱情蕩意。
translation: Again, he thinks, 'This is the king of the sugarcane, who's now at my side with measureless respect and affection, deeply attached in his mind, and indulging in emotions and thoughts.

source_sentence: 我今可更窮極婦人莊飾之法，所謂淨潔摩拭身體，香湯沐浴，使氣芬芳，
translation: I should now go beyond the adornments of a woman, such as wiping my body with cleanliness and moisture, bathing in scented warm water to make it fragrant.

source_sentence: 髮塗澤蘭，面著脂粉，花鬘瓔珞，種種莊嚴，令苷蔗王心於我邊重生耽湎愛戀娛樂。
translation: Their faces are covered with embellishments of various colors and adorned with flower ornaments, so that the lord of the gods may feel attached to me.

source_sentence: 若得如心，我於屏處，當乞求願。』
translation: If you get it according to your heart, I'll beg for it in a secluded place.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，如上所說，莊嚴自身，令極殊絕，至於王邊。
translation: After contemplating this, he adorned himself as described above and went to the king's side.

source_sentence: 王見妃來，生重愛敬，縱逸其心。
translation: When the king saw that the queen was coming, he cherished affection for her and even indulged in sexual desires.

source_sentence: 妃見王生如是心已，二人眠臥，妃白王言：『大王當知，我今從王，乞求一願，
translation: Seeing the king’s mind aroused in this way, the queen and the two men fell asleep. The queen said to the king, “O great king, you should know that I am now beg­ ing one thing from the king:

source_sentence: 願王與我。』
translation: May the king give it to me.'

source_sentence: 王言：『大妃！
translation: The king said, 'Great queen!

source_sentence: 隨意不逆，從心所欲，我當與妃。』
translation: Whatever you want, I'll give it to the queen as she wishes.'

source_sentence: 時妃復更重諮王言：『大王自在若與我願，不得變悔，若變悔者，我不須此。』
translation: The queen then again consulted the king again, saying, 'If the great king freely grants me my wishes, I won't change my mind; if I change my mind, I won't need them.'

source_sentence: 王語妃言：『我一與妃心之所願，後若悔者，當令我頭破作七分。』
translation: The king said to the queen, 'One thing I wish for with my queen's mind is that if I repent later, I'll have my head broken into seven parts.'

source_sentence: 妃言：『大王！
translation: The queen said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 王之四子，炬面等輩，願擯出國，遣我生子長壽為王。』
translation: The four sons of the king, including torch-faced and so forth, wish to leave home and send my birth as king with a long life span.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，即語妃言：『我此四子，無有過失，不橫求財，無有罪患，
translation: The lord of the sugarcane king said to his queen, “These four princes are free from error and dishonesty. They don’t seek wealth in vain and have no crime or offense.

source_sentence: 豈可無辜抂得駈遣遠擯他土？
translation: How can an innocent person be expelled from a distant land?

source_sentence: 於我治化國境之內，有何非祥不聽其住？』
translation: What's wrong with not listening to them inside the borders of my country where I rule and transform it?'

source_sentence: 妃又白言：『王已先誓，語若悔者頭破七分。』
translation: The queen also said, 'The king has previously vowed to say that if he repents, his head will break seven parts.'

source_sentence: 王告妃言：『我如前言與妃所願，妃若知時，任隨妃意。』
translation: The king told the queen, 'As I said before, I give my wishes to the queen, and if she knows them, she'll do as she wishes.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，過此夜後，至明清旦，集聚四子，而告勅言：『汝四童子！
translation: After the night passed, King Ikṣuvāku gathered his four sons at dawn and said to them, 'You four children!'

source_sentence: 今可出去我治化內，不得居住，遠向他國。』
translation: Now, you can go out and govern yourself inside me, but you won't be allowed to live there; you'll be far away from other countries.'

source_sentence: 「時四童子，胡跪合掌，白父王言：『大王！
translation: The four children then knelt down with joined palms and said to their father, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知我等四人，無有罪惡，無諸過咎，不作非法取他錢財，又復不造其餘惡業，
translation: You should know that we four are free of blameworthiness and blameless. We will not do anything unlawful to steal another’s money or property, nor commit any other evil deed.

source_sentence: 云何父王，忽然擯我出於國界？』
translation: How did my father, the king, suddenly pity me and leave the borders of his kingdom?'

source_sentence: 王勅子言：『我知汝等實無過失，不橫取財，如上所說，此非我意，駈擯於汝。
translation: The king said to his children, “I know that you really have nothing wrong with me. I will not plunder your wealth or property. As has been said above, this is not my idea.

source_sentence: 此是善賢大妃之意。
translation: This is the idea of the great queen Shanxian.

source_sentence: 彼妃乞願，我不違彼，令汝出國。』
translation: The queen begged me, saying, 'I won't disobey them and allow you to leave the country.'

source_sentence: 時四王子所生之母，聞苷蔗王，欲擯其子令出國界，聞已速疾往至王所。
translation: The mother of the four princes who were born at that time heard that King Ikṣuvāku wanted to deceive her son and order him to leave the country, but after hearing this she quickly went to the king.

source_sentence: 至王所已，白言大王：『聞王欲逐我之四子，令出國界，為實爾不？』
translation: When he arrived at the king's place, he said to the great king, 'Have you heard that the king wants to expel my four sons and allow them to leave the country? Is it true?'

source_sentence: 王言：『實遣。』
translation: The king said, 'It's really dismissed.'

source_sentence: 諸妃各復白於王言：『善哉！
translation: The queens each again said to the king, 'Good!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 我等各求乞隨兒去。』
translation: Each of us begged to go with our child.'

source_sentence: 「王報諸妃：『隨汝意去。』
translation: The king reported to the queens, 'Depart as you wish.'

source_sentence: 時諸妃妹復白王言：『我姊[外*男]甥，今既出國，我亦乞去。』
translation: The queens and sisters then again said to the king, 'My elder [outside*man] nephews, now that I'm leaving home, I'll also beg to leave.'

source_sentence: 王各報言：『任隨汝意。』
translation: Each of the kings replied, 'Let's do as you wish.'

source_sentence: 時諸大臣公卿輔相，亦白王言：『王今斥遣此四王子，令出國者，我等諸臣，
translation: The ministers and assistant ministers also said to the king, “The king has now expelled these four princes and ordered them to leave the country.

source_sentence: 亦求隨去。』
translation: They'll also seek to follow it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『任意。』
translation: The king said,'arbitrary.'

source_sentence: 時王典當諸象馬臣，亦求隨從，王言：『隨意。』
translation: The king then asked the elephant and horse ministers to follow him, and the king said, 'Do as you wish.'

source_sentence: 復有弓將弩將獄將、諸典當羊畜牧等將、諸臣之子，又復諸餘主藏兵將、遊軍壯士善射之將，
translation: There were also archer generals, crossbow generals, jailer generals, treasurer generals, sheepherd generals, etc., and the heirs of ministers.

source_sentence: 奴婢僕使及其子等，聞苷蔗王欲逐四子，令出國界，俱白王言：『我等並求隨從王子東西而去。』
translation: When the slaves, maidservants, servants, messengers, and their children heard that King Ikṣuvāku wanted to expel the four sons and ordered them to leave the country, they all said to the king, 'We're both seeking to follow the prince east and west.'

source_sentence: 王言：『隨意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 又復國內竹匠，皮匠，瓦師，塼師，造屋木師，造酒食師，剃鬚髮師，
translation: Furthermore, there were bamboo smiths, leatherworkers, tileworkers, brickworkers, carpenters, woodworkers, wine and food smiths, hair shavers, and barbers.

source_sentence: 染洗衣師，屠兒，按摩，治病，合藥，釣魚等師，聞王欲駈四子出國：『審如是不？』
translation: The washing and dyeing master, butcher, massent, massager, antidote, combined medicine, fisherman, and other masters heard that the king wanted to deport four sons, saying, 'Do you think it's right?'

source_sentence: 王言：『實爾。』
translation: The king said, 'It's true.'

source_sentence: 『我等求去。』
translation: 'We're seeking to leave.'

source_sentence: 王言：『隨意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，勅諸王子，作如是言：『汝等王子！
translation: The king of sugarcane then commanded the princes to say, 'You princes!

source_sentence: 從今已去，若欲婚姻，不得餘處取他外族，還於自家姓內而取，莫令苷蔗種姓斷絕。』
translation: From now on, if they want to marry, they won't be allowed to take other non-Buddhist clans from another place or take them back inside their own family and don't allow the sugarcane seeds to be cut off.'

source_sentence: 時，諸王子白父王言：『如大王勅。』
translation: The princes then said to their father, 'Thus has the great king commanded them.'

source_sentence: 「彼諸王子，受父教已，各各自將所生之母，并姨姊妹、奴婢資財、諸馱乘等，
translation: Having received their father’s instruction, each of those princes brought his mother and the aunt, sisters, male and female servants, as well as all the other members of the sangha.

source_sentence: 即向北方到雪山下，經少時住，有一大河，名婆耆羅洟，渡於彼河，上雪山頂，
translation: He proceeded northward to the foot of the Snowy Mountains and stayed there for a short time. There was a big river called Vāgṛhāraṇī, which he crossed at the top of the summit of the Snowy Mountains.

source_sentence: 遊涉久停。
translation: He traveled and stayed there for a long time.

source_sentence: 時四王子，在彼山頂，射獵捕諸禽獸而食，漸漸前行，至山南面，見川寬平，
translation: At that time the four princes were on the summit of the mountain, shooting and hunting at birds and beasts to feed them. They proceeded gradually toward the southern side of the mountain and saw a wide and peaceful plain in the valley.

source_sentence: 無諸坑坎堆阜陵谷丘壑溝渠、荊棘塵埃及沙礫等，其地唯生軟細青草，
translation: There are no pits, hollows, mounds, hills, valleys, ditches, streams, or rivers; the soil is not covered with dirt, dust, sand, or gravel. The land produces only soft and fine green grass.

source_sentence: 清淨可愛，樹林花果，蔚茂敷榮，猶如黑雲，光澤儵鑠。
translation: It is pure and lovely to behold, with luxuriant flowers and fruit growing in the forests like black clouds shining brightly and dazzlingly.

source_sentence: 林木遍滿，其間少空，所謂娑羅樹、多羅樹、那多摩羅樹、阿說他樹、尼拘陀樹、優曇婆羅樹、千年棗樹、迦梨羅樹等，
translation: The forests and trees are pervaded, and there's a little space between them: so-called sal trees, palm trees, palm trees, rhododendron trees, nādamala trees, asuras, nyagrodha trees, udumbara trees, thousand-year-old jujue trees, pārijātaka trees, and other

source_sentence: 垂諸枝柯，各相蔭映。
translation: The branches and flowering trees cast shade on each other.

source_sentence: 又有種種諸雜妙花，所謂阿提目多華、瞻波華、阿輸迦華、波多羅花、婆利師迦華、拘蘭那華、拘毘陀羅花、檀奴沙迦梨迦花、目真隣陀華、蘇摩那等，
translation: There were also various kinds of mixed and wonderful flowers, such as the atimutaka flower, campaka flower, aśoka flower, pratila flower, vārṣika flower, pāriṣṭika flower, kalana flower, kovidāra flower, sanduṣa-karika flower, maucilinda flower, sumana flower, and so

source_sentence: 一切諸華，或有已開，或有未開，或初欲開，或開已落。
translation: All the flowers may have bloomed or not bloomed, some are about to bloom for the first time, and some fall down after blooming.

source_sentence: 復有無量眾雜果樹，所謂菴婆羅果、閻浮果、陵拘闍果、波那婆果、鎮頭迦果、呵梨勒果、毘醯勒果、阿摩勒等，
translation: There were also trees of innumerable different kinds of fruit, such as camphor, jambu, lingkoja, pineapple, mango, āmalaka, khadira, Videla, amala, and so on.

source_sentence: 種種諸果，或始結子，或子欲熟，或子已熟，堪可食噉。
translation: The various fruits may begin to bind the seeds, or the seeds may want to ripen, or the seeds are ripe and ready to eat.

source_sentence: 「復有無量諸雜野獸，所謂伊泥耶獸，麞鹿水牛，那羅迦獸，野牛白象，
translation: “Furthermore, there are innumerable various wild animals: the so-called linen animals, mules, deer, water buffaloes, nāraka animals, wild cattle, and white elephants.

source_sentence: 及師子等。
translation: and the lion and so forth.

source_sentence: 復有無量種種飛鳥，所謂鸚鵡，及拘翅羅、鸜鵒孔雀、迦陵頻伽、命命鵁鶄、山鷄白鶴、遮摩迦鳥，
translation: There were also innumerable other kinds of flying birds, such as the so-called parrot and the kumbhīra, the garuḍa, the gandharva, the kalaviṅka, the jīvaka, the mountain fowl, the white crane, and the cāmaka.

source_sentence: 及蘭摩等一切雜鳥。
translation: and all the mixed birds such as lāma.

source_sentence: 復有無量諸水，陂池其池，各有種種雜花，所謂優鉢羅華、波頭摩花、拘勿頭華、分陀利華，
translation: There were also innumerable other waters, and each pond contained various kinds of flowers: blue lotus blossoms, pink lotus blossoms, red lotus blossoms, white lotus blossoms, black lotus blossoms, and white lotus blossoms.

source_sentence: 悉滿諸池池岸四邊。
translation: They all fill the four sides of the pond and lake shore.

source_sentence: 復有諸華，垂覆池上，其水清淨，無有濁穢，湛然彌滿，不深不淺，易度易行，
translation: There were also various kinds of flowers that covered the pond. The water was pure, without any dirt or dirt, perfectly clear, neither too deep nor too shallow, easy to cross and easy to walk in.

source_sentence: 周匝四邊，種種諸樹。
translation: It is surrounded on all four sides by a variety of trees.

source_sentence: 池內復有種種諸虫，所謂魚鼈黿鼉龜鼇螺蜂，一切水性。
translation: Inside the pond there are also various kinds of insects, called fish, turtles, tortoises, seashells, and bees, which are all water by nature.

source_sentence: 復有小鳥，所謂鳧鴈鵝鴨、白鷺鸕鶿及鴛鴦等，一切諸鳥。
translation: Again, there are small birds that are called geese, ducks, white herons, eagles, and mandarin ducks, and all the other birds.

source_sentence: 然其彼處，舊有一仙，在中居止，名迦毘羅。
translation: At that place, however, there was once an old sage named Kapilavastu, who lived and stayed there.

source_sentence: 彼諸王子，見是處已，共相謂言：『可於此間造城治化。』
translation: Seeing this place, the princes said to each other, 'May I build a city here to govern it?'

source_sentence: 「爾時王子既安住已，憶父王語，於自姓中，求覓婚姻，不能得婦，各納姨母及其姊妹，
translation: “Then, having settled there, the prince remembered his father’s words. He sought a bride in his own country but could not find one. Each of them took their aunt and sisters with him.

source_sentence: 共為夫妻。
translation: Together, they became husband and wife.

source_sentence: 依於婦禮，一欲隨從父王教令，二恐釋種雜亂相生。
translation: Depending on the woman's manner, they first want to follow the instructions of their father and king and second fear that the Śākyas will be born together in a mixed way.

source_sentence: 爾時，日種苷蔗之王，召一國師大婆羅門，來謂之言：『大婆羅門！
translation: At the time, the king of the sun-seeding sugarcane summoned a great brāhmaṇa named national teacher and came to him, saying, 'Great brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我四王子，今在何處？』
translation: Where are my four princes now?'

source_sentence: 國師答言：『大王！
translation: The national teacher replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知王之四子，已各自將母姨姊妹馱乘人物，遠出國外，向於北方，乃至已生端政男女。』

source_sentence: 「爾時護明菩薩大士，見彼天眾及梵釋天、護世、諸龍、毘舍闍等，觀察彼眾，
translation: “At that time, the bodhisattva Mahāprajñāpāramitā Bodhisattva observed those celestial beings and Brahmadeva gods, world-protectors, dragons, nāgas, and piśācīs.

source_sentence: 心意泰然，不恐不驚，不疑不畏，出柔軟語，而告之言：『汝諸仁者！
translation: Their minds and hearts are peaceful, they aren't afraid or frightened, don't doubt or fear, speak softly, and tell them, 'You people!

source_sentence: 各各當知！
translation: Each one should be known!

source_sentence: 如我今見有此五種衰相出時，不久從於兜率天下生於人間。』
translation: Suppose I now see that when these five kinds of declining characteristics emerge, I won't be born among humans from the world in Tuṣita soon.'

source_sentence: 時梵釋等諸天報言：『尊者護明！
translation: The Brahmas and other gods then replied, 'Venerable guard!

source_sentence: 如尊所見，五種衰相出現之者，尊必不久當下兜率生於人間，尊可憶念昔本行願。』
translation: As the venerable has seen, if five signs of decay appear to him, the venerable will surely descend down from Tuṣita and be born among humans before long, and the venerable can remember his past vows.'

source_sentence: 時彼無量百千天眾，發是語已，遍體戰慄，身毛皆竪，心大驚怖，合十指掌，
translation: Countless hundreds of thousands of celestial beings said these words, trembling all over their bodies and hair standing on end in great fear, joining their ten-fingered palms.

source_sentence: 頂禮護明。
translation: He bowed his head in respect and guarded the light.

source_sentence: 「爾時，護明告彼眾言：『我今必下，決定無疑。
translation: At that point, Kauśina then addressed the crowd, saying, 'Now, I will surely go down and have no doubt.

source_sentence: 時今已至，是故汝等應念無常，當想未來恐怖之事，汝等善觀身體穢污，
translation: Because the time has now come. Therefore, you should be aware of impermanence and think of future fears. You should carefully examine your bodies to see if they are defiled.

source_sentence: 心強愛著，以是諸欲共相纏繞，於生死中，不得出離。
translation: Their minds are strongly attached, and because they're bound by these common bonds of desire, they can't escape in birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 如是臭形，甚可厭惡。
translation: Such a foul-smelling shape is very disgusting.

source_sentence: 汝等一切，合十指掌，觀我身體，及諸眾生，相與未能免脫此法。
translation: All of you, put your palms together with your ten fingers and look at my body and the characteristics of sentient beings, who are unable to escape this teaching.

source_sentence: 是故汝等為我莫愁，為我莫苦。』
translation: Therefore, don't grieve for me and don't suffer for me.'

source_sentence: 彼諸天言：『尊者護明！
translation: The gods said, 'Venerable guard!

source_sentence: 唯願尊者慈悲普覆，亦莫更生其餘諸心，但念往昔本誓因緣，億劫生身，
translation: May it please you, venerable one, to overwhelm them with compassion and not give rise to any other thought but think of the causes and conditions of your past vows for a hundred myriads of world ages.

source_sentence: 尊亦曾受天人業果。
translation: The Bhagavān has also experienced the results of the actions of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 往昔所造善業因緣，憶念彼施善根法行，於諸眾生，生慈悲心。』
translation: For the sake of the causes and conditions of good actions created in the past, he remembers the practice of giving good roots to sentient beings and gives rise to compassion for them.'

source_sentence: 護明菩薩，報諸天言：『汝等當知！
translation: The luminous guard bodhisattva replied to the gods, saying, 'You should know!'

source_sentence: 一切眾生，於世間中及以生處，但令是有，但令是生，不免分離，況復於我？
translation: All sentient beings are only caused to exist in the world and the place where they are born, but they are only caused to be born, so they can't escape separation, much less self.

source_sentence: 又諸眾生，皆悉無常，恩愛別離，云何得脫？』
translation: Furthermore, all sentient beings are impermanent, and when kindness and love are separated, how can they be liberated?'

source_sentence: 「是時，諸天復更白言：『希有希有！
translation: Again, the gods said, 'How rare and rare!'

source_sentence: 尊者護明！
translation: Venerable Upagupta!

source_sentence: 難可思議，能於無常境界之中，臨捨壽時，心得辯才，一種達解，無有別異。
translation: The difficulty is inconceivable, for when he approaches the end of his life in the realm of impermanence, he's mindful of his eloquence and has one kind of comprehension, which has no distinctions or differences.

source_sentence: 尊者護明！
translation: Venerable Upagupta!

source_sentence: 又復一切自餘諸天，見此五種衰相現時，心即憂愁，失於正念。』
translation: Furthermore, all the other gods themselves see these five signs of decay that appear, and their minds are grieved and lost right mindfulness.'

source_sentence: 護明菩薩復更重告諸天眾言：『一生補處諸菩薩等，善根增長，知諸有處，
translation: Again, the Bodhisattva Paranirmita-vaśavartin repeatedly addressed the celestial beings, saying: All bodhisattvas who are reborn as human beings in one lifetime increase their roots of goodness.

source_sentence: 於功德中寂定其心，苦來逼切不生諸惱，乃至不隨諸苦而行，能於一切諸眾生邊，
translation: In the midst of virtue, they quietly concentrate their minds; being oppressed by suffering, they do not give rise to afflictions, and so on, up to acting without compulsion—they are able to cause all sentient beings to be liberated.

source_sentence: 起大慈悲。』
translation: He gives rise to great compassion.'

source_sentence: 時諸天言：『如是如是！
translation: The gods then said, 'So it is!

source_sentence: 尊者護明！
translation: Venerable Upagupta!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，於彼人間，種諸善根，生此天宮，此處福盡，還即退下。』
translation: All sentient beings who plant good roots in those people will be born in this heavenly palace, and when their merits here have ended, they'll regress back down.'

source_sentence: 「護明菩薩復告天言：『我以是故，見人天中有是過失。
translation: Again, the Bodhisattva Paranirmita-vaśavartin told the gods, 'It's because of this that I see these faults in humans and gods.

source_sentence: 我今從此下生人間，為諸世間一切眾生，滅盡諸苦。』
translation: From here, I'll now be born among humans and cease suffering for the sake of all sentient beings in the world.'

source_sentence: 是時彼中，有一天女，愛樂戀著護明菩薩，復更別告一天女言：『我等可至閻浮提中觀我大家護明菩薩，
translation: Then one of the goddesses said to another goddess, “Let us go to Jambudvfpa and see this enlightening being Light-protecting Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 於何處生？』
translation: Where will it be produced?'

source_sentence: 彼天女言：『我今亦樂於閻浮提。
translation: The goddesses said, 'Now, I'm also happy in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 我之大家欲生彼處，是故我亦願在彼間。』
translation: My people want to be born there; therefore, I also want to be there.'

source_sentence: 時二天女，復相謂言：『我亦不為此大家故，願往生彼。
translation: The two heavenly maidens then again said to each other, 'I also wish to be born there for the sake of this group of people.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 我此大家往閻浮提，則有無量無邊眾生種諸善根，於中信受，而行教化，
translation: “O Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī! When we go to Jambudvīpa, there will be countless and limitless sentient beings who have planted roots of goodness. They will believe in these roots of goodness and practice them.

source_sentence: 復有無量無邊眾生，修諸福業，來生此處。』
translation: Again, there are measureless and limitless sentient beings who cultivate meritorious actions and come to be born here.'

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五
translation: Fobenxing ji jing, vol. 5
